page.title: 03Our School 2 - Sheerness
page.content: The pupils at Lady Anne Cheyne {School}for Girls are aged between 9 and 13. Many of the girls who attend the school live in the surrounding area although a number travel from Leysdown, Minster, Eastchurch and Queenborough by public{transport.}This means an early start has to be made by those who live at the far end of the Isle of Sheppey which is twelve miles away. It is because of the transport problems that{clubs}are held during the lunch break rather than after school unless by special arrangement. Competitions against other schools both on and off the{island}take place throughout the year in a variety of activities.
